metadata.Title: CVE-2012-0839 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
OCaml 3.12.1 and earlier computes hash values without restricting theability to trigger hash collisions predictably, which allowscontext-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption)via crafted input to an application that maintains a hash table.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-0839` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

camlp4 - 4.01.0-3ubuntu3
camlp4-extra - 4.01.0-3ubuntu3
ocaml - 4.01.0-3ubuntu3
ocaml-base - 4.01.0-3ubuntu3
ocaml-base-nox - 4.01.0-3ubuntu3
ocaml-compiler-libs - 4.01.0-3ubuntu3
ocaml-interp - 4.01.0-3ubuntu3
ocaml-mode - 4.01.0-3ubuntu3
ocaml-native-compilers - 4.01.0-3ubuntu3
ocaml-nox - 4.01.0-3ubuntu3
ocaml-source - 4.01.0-3ubuntu3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ocaml package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.01.0-3ubuntu3').
